definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to come one after the other
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd

sentences.english: And after April, when May follows.
sentences.chinese: 四月过去，五月接踵来到。

sentences.english: Not only is our poor Planet Earth suffering from natural calamities, it is battered by man-made disASters AS well.
sentences.chinese: 现今可怜的地球不仅是天灾频仍，人祸更是接踵不断。

sentences.english: After the defeat great disorders followed.
sentences.chinese: 失败之后，接踵而来的是大混乱。

sentences.english: Fleece goes in the bag. Repeat with countless other items.
sentences.chinese: 长袖衫入袋，无数其他物品接踵而来。

sentences.english: Then had come the great battles of the artillery .
sentences.chinese: 接踵而至的是大规模的炮战。

sentences.english: Undisputedly in war times some heroes come on the heel of the others.
sentences.chinese: 毫无争议在战争时代一些英雄接踵而置。

sentences.english: After honor And state, follow envy And hate.
sentences.chinese: 有了名位，嫉妒和仇恨便接踵而至。

sentences.english: The followers went there forget the essence of religon then we * and we have problems.
sentences.chinese: 是信徒们忘记了宗教的原旨，于是问题接踵而至。

sentences.english: Earth suffering from natural calamities, it is battered by man-made disASters AS well.
sentences.chinese: 现今可怜的地球不仅是天灾频仍，人祸更是接踵不断。

sentences.english: A water shortage had struck the area and the wild life was dying off alarmighly in the intense heat.
sentences.chinese: 缺水威胁这一带，野生动物在持续高温下接踵而死。

sentences.english: Troubles that come, happiness that fulfills, and eternity which someday will be.
sentences.chinese: 麻烦接踵而来，幸福亦会来临，永远会在某天出现。

sentences.english: Wealth often comes along with fame.
sentences.chinese: 接踵而至就是滚滚而来的财富。
接踵而来的是一场短暂的骂战。

sentences.english: But after back-to-back hurricanes, it is running short on funds.
sentences.chinese: 但是接踵而至的飓风导致资金不足。

sentences.english: Amid all this hand-wringing, Americans have kept piling on more and more debt.
sentences.chinese: 美国人对于接踵而至的债务清单手忙脚乱。

sentences.english: The market-place was full of women, the streets packed with men.
sentences.chinese: 商场里妇女摩肩接踵，街上男人比比皆是。

definition: to come one after the other
small craftsman (contemptuous)/clatter (e.g. of footsteps)/jumbled mass/press of bodies/tumult
to turn on one's heel/in the twinkle of an eye/instantly
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
to spring up everywhere/from all around
